sentences.en: Anxiety can interfere with children’s performance at school.
sentences.cn: 焦虑会影响孩子在学校的表现。

sentences.en: Don't interfere in other's private concerns.
Don't interfere in what doesn't concern you.
sentences.cn: 不要管与自己无关的事。

sentences.en: Family frictions can interfere with a child's schoolwork.
sentences.cn: 家庭中的争吵会影响孩子的学业.

sentences.en: He does not want to interfere in the internal affairs of another country.
He knew when to leave well alone and when to interfere.
sentences.cn: 他知道什么时候该适可而止，什么时候该插手干预。

sentences.en: I never interfere in his business.
If we interfere, it may do more harm than good.
sentences.cn: 如果我们干预的话, 可能弊多利少.

sentences.en: It is not within my province to interfere.
sentences.cn: 这不是我所应当干涉的.

sentences.en: It will seriously interfere with the progress of the work.
sentences.cn: 它将严重干扰工作的进展.

sentences.en: My daughter-in-law said that I was interfering, but I was only trying to help.
sentences.cn: 我的儿媳说我多管闲事，但我只是想帮忙。

sentences.en: She never allows her private affairs to interfere with production.
sentences.cn: 她从不为个人事情耽误生产.

sentences.en: The hearing-impaired say digital phones interfere with hearing aids.
sentences.cn: 听觉障碍者反映数字电话会对助听器造成干扰。

sentences.en: When others interfere in the affair, it always makes troubles.
sentences.cn: 别人一卷入这一事件, 棘手的事情就来了.

sentences.en: When others interfere, it always makes trouble.
sentences.cn: 别人一干涉, 麻烦就来了.

phrases.tran_cn: 干扰，干涉；妨碍；触动或弄坏；乱动；与……抵触

trans.tran_en: to deliberately get involved in a situation where you are not wanted or needed
to deliberately get involved in a situation where you are not wanted or needed

trans.tran_cn: 干涉， 干预， 妨碍
trans.tran_en: to deliberately get involved in a situation where you are not wanted or needed
